unnormalised: Athlete biographies offer a captivating glimpse into the lives, struggles, and triumphs of individuals who have dedicated themselves to the pursuit of sporting excellence. These narratives transcend mere recounting of statistics and match results, providing readers with a deeper understanding of the person behind the performance, their motivations, and the cultural contexts that shaped their journey. From the dusty maidans of small-town India to the glittering stadiums of global competitions, these stories resonate deeply, particularly when they feature athletes who have overcome adversity to achieve greatness.

It paints a vivid picture of post-independence India, the societal pressures, and the raw determination that fueled his relentless training regime. Such biographies offer valuable insights into the socio-economic realities that athletes often navigate, adding layers of complexity and inspiration to their achievements. He began training rigorously in 1952, dreaming of making India proud.
